get.description: List all connectors to understand what integrations are available to configure

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description:
Comma separated list of fields to optionally expand.

Available Options: `integrations`

schema.description:
Comma separated list of fields to optionally expand.

Available Options: `integrations`
List of connectors with selected fields

get.description: List the connectors that are configured in your account and available for your customers

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of items returned

schema.description: Limit the number of items returned
Offset the items returned

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description:
Comma separated list of fields to optionally expand.

Available Options: `connector`, `enabled_integrations`

schema.description:
Comma separated list of fields to optionally expand.

Available Options: `connector`, `enabled_integrations`
The name of the connector

total.description: Total number of items in the database for the organization

limit.description: Limit the number of items returned

schema.description: The list of connector configurations

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from openint import Openint

client = Openint(
    api_key=os.environ.get("OPENINT_API_KEY"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
page = client.list_connection_configs()
page = page.items[0]
print(page)

get.description: Get details of a specific connection, including credentials

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the connection, starts with `conn_`

schema.description: The id of the connection, starts with `conn_`

parameters.name: include_secrets
parameters.description: Controls secret inclusion: none (default), basic (auth only), or all secrets

schema.description: Controls secret inclusion: none (default), basic (auth only), or all secrets

parameters.name: refresh_policy
parameters.description: Controls credential refresh: none (never), force (always), or auto (when expired, default)

schema.description: Controls credential refresh: none (never), force (always), or auto (when expired, default)

items.description: Fields to expand: connector (includes connector details)

schema.description: The connection details

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from openint import Openint

client = Openint(
    api_key=os.environ.get("OPENINT_API_KEY"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
response = client.get_connection(
    id="conn_",
)
print(response)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the connection, starts with `conn_`

schema.description: The id of the connection, starts with `conn_`

id.description: The id of the connection, starts with `conn_`

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from openint import Openint

client = Openint(
    api_key=os.environ.get("OPENINT_API_KEY"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
response = client.delete_connection(
    "conn_",
)
print(response.id)

get.description: List all connections with optional filtering. Does not retrieve secrets or perform any connection healthcheck. For that use `getConnection` or `checkConnectionHealth`.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of items returned

schema.description: Limit the number of items returned
Offset the items returned
The name of the connector

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: The id of the customer in your application. Ensure it is unique for that customer.

schema.description: The id of the customer in your application. Ensure it is unique for that customer.

parameters.name: connector_config_id
parameters.description: The id of the connector config, starts with `ccfg_`

schema.description: The id of the connector config, starts with `ccfg_`

parameters.name: include_secrets
parameters.description: Controls secret inclusion: none (default), basic (auth only), or all secrets

schema.description: Controls secret inclusion: none (default), basic (auth only), or all secrets

items.description: Fields to expand: connector (includes connector details)

total.description: Total number of items in the database for the organization

limit.description: Limit the number of items returned

schema.description: The list of connections

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from openint import Openint

client = Openint(
    api_key=os.environ.get("OPENINT_API_KEY"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
page = client.list_connections()
page = page.items[0]
print(page)

post.description: Import an existing connection after validation

connector_config_id.description: The id of the connector config, starts with `ccfg_`

customer_id.description: The id of the customer in your application. Ensure it is unique for that customer.

post.description: Verify that a connection is healthy

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the connection, starts with `conn_`

schema.description: The id of the connection, starts with `conn_`

id.description: The id of the connection, starts with `conn_`

status.description: Connection status: healthy (all well), disconnected (needs reconnection), error (system issue), manual (import connection)

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from openint import Openint

client = Openint(
    api_key=os.environ.get("OPENINT_API_KEY"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
response = client.check_connection(
    "conn_",
)
print(response.id)

post.description: Create a magic link that is ready to be shared with customers who want to use Connect

validity_in_seconds.description: How long the magic link will be valid for (in seconds) before it expires

connector_name.description: The name of the connector to limit connection to. Default to all otherwise

tab.title: Default Tab
tab.description: The default tab to show when the magic link is opened. Defaults to "my-connections"

client_options.description: Search params to configure the connect page. Not signed as part of JWT and therefore can be modified by client

magic_link_url.description: The Connect magic link url to share with the user.

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from openint import Openint

client = Openint(
    api_key=os.environ.get("OPENINT_API_KEY"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
response = client.create_magic_link(
    customer_id="x",
)
print(response.magic_link_url)

post.description: Create a @Connect authentication token for a customer. This token can be used to embed @Connect in your application via the `@openint/connect` npm package.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: The id of the customer in your application. Ensure it is unique for that customer.

schema.description: The id of the customer in your application. Ensure it is unique for that customer.

validity_in_seconds.description: How long the token will be valid for (in seconds) before it expires

token.description: The authentication token to use for API requests

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from openint import Openint

client = Openint(
    api_key=os.environ.get("OPENINT_API_KEY"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
response = client.create_token(
    customer_id="customer_id",
)
print(response.token)

get.description: Check if the API is operational
Get information about the current authenticated user

x-codeSamples.source:
import os
from openint import Openint

client = Openint(
    api_key=os.environ.get("OPENINT_API_KEY"),  # This is the default and can be omitted
)
response = client.get_current_user()
print(response.role)

ApiKey.description: Organization API key generated in the OpenInt Console and passed in the `authorization` header with format: `Bearer {apiKey}`

CustomerToken.description: Customer authentication token created using the create customer token API and passed in the `authorization` header with format: `Bearer {token}`
